messages.content: Please rewrite this passage more concisely:  The people are very nice. I've been in a few different Muslim countries and during their holy month on Ramadan where they fast every day and eat at night (usually fast all day until around 7:30pm).  I've been invited out to eat with new muslim friend here and there when they break fast.  It's really a sobering experience.  One guy shared with me his dinner that he brought that his mom cooked.  Another one was poor and still insisted on paying for our dinner. We'd never hear of such kindness and generosity from the fake news media about that.  It's really a humbling experience.

Here is a more concise rewrite:

The people are very nice.  During Ramadan, when Muslims fast all day and eat after sunset, I've been invited to break fast with new Muslim friends.  They share their meals and insist on paying, despite being poor.  Such kindness and generosity contrast with negative media portrayals. It's a humbling experience.

Please rewrite this passage more concisely: Speaking of Dengue fever, we didn't have it but our friend and his son did. I suggested that they take some supplements (that I researched) and they did but they only had like 2-3 days worth.  It turns out their recovery was much faster than their family members even though they had only a short amount.

Here is a more concise rewrite:

Our friend and son had Dengue fever. I suggested supplements I researched. Though they only took for 2-3 days, their recovery was much faster than family, despite short duration.

Please rewrite this passage more concisely: God bless her mother for coming out to help us with baby Joe. She's a blessing. Joe is lucky and blessed to have at least one of his grandparents alive. God knows that I had none.  I told her mother that she can stay as long as she wants and that she's always welcome here. Maybe the mother-in-law relationship might be different if you married a man? In asian cultures the new wife must obey her mother-in-law.  However, in a traditional patriarchy, the mother-in-law treats the son-in-law with respect and approval.

Here's a more concise rewrite:  

Joe's grandmother is a blessing, helping with baby Joe. He's lucky to have one grandparent alive, unlike me. I told her she's welcome as long as she wants. Mother-in-law relationships may differ if you marry a man, with obedience required in some cultures. But traditionally, mothers-in-law respect and approve of sons-in-law in patriarchies.
